basics.name: Woo Seok Jung
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: A Korean-born American PhD candidate in the Brent lab at WashU

publications.name: A methodology for gene level omics-WAS integration identifies genes influencing traits associated with cardiovascular risks: the Long Life Family Study
publications.summary: Multi-omic integration of GWAS, RVA (rare variant analysis), and gene-trait associations to identify genetic mechanisms that affect cardiovascular health risks in the Long Life Family Study (LLFS). I wrote the nf-core Nextflow pipeline https://nf-co.re/omicsgenetraitassociation.

publications.name: Predicting which genes will respond to transcription factor perturbations
publications.summary: Prediction of gene response to transcription factor perturbations modeling TF perturbation experiments using TF ChIP-seq data and epigenetic signals using XGBoost.

awards.title: Genome Analysis Traning Progarm (GATP)
awards.summary: The NHGRI T32 grant, also known as a Ruth L. Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) Institutional Research Training Grant, supports predoctoral trainees to strenghten their research experiences in genomics.

awards.title: Thomas Malcolm and Hilda Enden Jack Scholarship
